alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:35PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Yukon River near Marshall to St. Mary`s, including the village of Pilot Station * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam about 25 mi downstream of Russian Mission has released and is likely to release water to communities downstream of the jam. River levels are expected to continue to rise as impounded high water behind these ice jams continues to push downstream, likely leading to flooding down to St. Mary`s * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As of 2:30 PM AKDT Friday, An ice jam upstream of Pilot Station released Wednesday night causing water levels to rise 4 feet in Pilot Station with bank-to-bank tightly packed ice and river levels approaching homes near the bank. Water levels have also risen rapidly Wednesday night and yesterday morning in Marshall and St. Mary`s. Water levels remain high. Residents in these locations should be prepared for a long period of high water even after the ice jams release. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood If you live near or along the Yukon River from Marshall to St. Mary`s stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
